channel.title: CVE Feed for Advantech -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Advantech -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-22987|2024-08-03T03:28:42.705Z -- advantech -- adam-3600
item.description: The affected product has a hardcoded private key available inside the project folder, which may allow an attacker to achieve Web Server login and perform further actions.

item.title: CVE-2022-3386|2024-08-03T01:07:06.514Z -- advantech -- r-seenet
item.description: Advantech R-SeeNet Versions 2.4.17 and prior are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. An unauthorized attacker can use an outsized filename to overflow the stack buffer and enable remote code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-3387|2024-08-03T01:07:06.640Z -- advantech -- r-seenet
item.description: Advantech R-SeeNet Versions 2.4.19 and prior are vulnerable to path traversal attacks. An unauthorized attacker could remotely exploit vulnerable PHP code to delete .PDF files.

item.title: CVE-2022-3385|2024-08-03T01:07:06.589Z -- advantech -- r-seenet
item.description: Advantech R-SeeNet Versions 2.4.17 and prior are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. An unauthorized attacker can remotely overflow the stack buffer and enable remote code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-2453|2024-08-01T19:11:53.526Z -- advantech -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: There is an SQL injection vulnerability in Advantech WebAccess/SCADA software that allows an authenticated attacker to remotely inject SQL code in the database. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to read or modify data on the remote database.

item.title: CVE-2024-2453|2024-03-21T22:39:38.185Z -- advantech -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: There is an SQL injection vulnerability in Advantech WebAccess/SCADA software that allows an authenticated attacker to remotely inject SQL code in the database. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to read or modify data on the remote database.

item.title: CVE-2024-2453|2024-07-08T19:52:58.826Z -- advantech -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: There is an SQL injection vulnerability in Advantech WebAccess/SCADA software that allows an authenticated attacker to remotely inject SQL code in the database. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to read or modify data on the remote database.
